text: The 1999 IBF World Championships were held in Copenhagen, Denmark, between 10 May and 23 May 1999. ==Host city selection== Copenhagen, Denmark, was chosen over Gothenburg, Sweden, as the host for 1999 IBF World Championships. ==Medalists== ===Medal table=== ===Events=== {| |- |rowspan=2|Men's Singles |rowspan=2| Sun Jun |rowspan=2|20 px Fung Permadi | Peter Gade |- | Poul-Erik Høyer Larsen |- |rowspan=2|Women's Singles |rowspan=2| Camilla Martin |rowspan=2| Dai Yun | Gong Ruina |- | Mette Sørensen |- |rowspan=2|Men's Doubles |rowspan=2| Ha Tae-kwon Kim Dong-moon |rowspan=2| Lee Dong-soo Yoo Yong-sung | Zhang Wei Zhang Jun |- | Simon Archer Nathan Robertson |- |rowspan=2|Women's Doubles |rowspan=2| Ge Fei Gu Jun |rowspan=2| Ra Kyung-min Chung Jae-hee | Qin Yiyuan Gao Ling |- | Ann Jørgensen Majken Vange |- |rowspan=2|Mixed Doubles |rowspan=2| Kim Dong-moon Ra Kyung-min |rowspan=2| Simon Archer Joanne Goode | Liu Yong Ge Fei |- | Michael Søgaard Rikke Olsen |} ==Final stage== === Men's Singles === === Women's Singles === === Men's Doubles === === Women's Doubles === === Mixed Doubles === ==References== ==External links== *http://www.tournamentsoftware.com/sport/events.aspx?id=0C8BEFBC-C502-47FB-8C0B-A57F034F3452 *http://www.worldbadminton.com/results/19990518_WorldChampionships/results.htm Category:BWF World Championships IBF World Championships Badminton Category:May 1999 sports events in Europe Category:International sports competitions in Copenhagen Category:Badminton tournaments in Denmark Category:1990s in Copenhagen
title: 1999 IBF World Championships
